page.title: 03Environment,New Galloway
page.content: The village has, already, been described on Page 1. The surrounding area consists, largely, of{Forestry} with spectacular views through planned gaps.Timber processing takes place locally. Clatteringshaws to the North and Bennan to the West of New Galloway are owned by the Forestry Commission.The trees grown are Sitka Spruce, Norway Spruce, Scots Pine, Noble Fir, Douglas Fir, Lodgepole Pine, Japanese Larch and Hybrid Larch.The soil in the area is ideal for this type of growth.If you walk to the top of the golf course, you can see the delightful landscape, including the River Ken, 200 metres beyond the village. The {Climate}is rather warm and wet compared to Scotland as a whole. Persistantly bad weather pruduces flooding in the village's lower plains
